alert.note: Alert for Northern Clinton; Southern Clinton; Southern Lycoming; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 8:51AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN LYCOMING...SOUTHERN CLINTON...UNION...AND NORTHERN CLINTON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 850 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Renovo to near Lock Haven to Mifflinburg and moving southeast at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Mifflinburg around 855 AM EST. Carroll, Vicksburg and Castanea around 900 AM EST. McElhattan, Dunnstown and R.B. Winter State Park around 905 AM EST. Hyner around 910 AM EST. Sand Bridge State Park around 915 AM EST. Forest Hill around 920 AM EST. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Lock Haven and Lewisburg-Williamsport exits, specifically from mile markers 181 to 200. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Northern Clinton; Southern Clinton; Southern Lycoming; Union
